item.title: An elongated hole in the road., 26th February
item.description:
We were walking from Bradley Road towards the Clock Tower (Pub) on the left hand side of the road at about 18.00hrs (25/02/2024) As we approached the Kings Hollow turning a car came up behind us indicating it wanted to turn into Kings Hollow and had stop to let us clear the turning. As there was no other traffic coming I decided to close the road, so the car could the go into Kings Hollow. However as I crossed the road my foot caught the hole in road causing me to fall over and cut my hands and knee. So the hole is a danger to pedestrians when crossing the road, which since the Lidi opened more and more people will be crossing the road to get to Lidi.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 178, Cirencester Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree at risk of damaging property, 26th February
item.description:
The tree adjacent to the side garden wall of no 4 Vilverie Mead has been badly pollarded in the past. Today a surveyor working on the national tree survey viewed it and advised us that it is in poor condition and that strong winds could bring it down. This tree has been reported to TBC by the homeowner of No 4 on previous occasions. As it is adjacent to two properties it needs to be assessed by our council arborist team please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vilverie Mead, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: See below, 26th February
item.description:
Men arrived today to repair the potholes along Hartley lane from the Seven Springs roundabout to the Cotsway Barn turn in the road. Your white paint was washed away long ago with the rain and the shape of the holes has changed. The men tell me they have problems identifying the correct holes. There remain at lease 6 sizeable potholes along this route following the repairs today and the lane where most repairs have taken place remains less of a road and more of an uneven patchwork quilt which will likely last less than 2 months. Please return and complete the filling in of the remaining potholes I reported to you a month ago. I have already replaced 2 shock absorbers and 2 tyres on my car!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartley Lane, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 26th February

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 26th February
item.description:
Road experiencing heavy surface degradation issues - customer believes that this partly due to this road regularly flooding and not draining away properly, is asking if grips can be cut along the lane to aid in drainage to the roadside ditches
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Suckers from diseased tree rising on private property, which are coppicing where cut off. This tree and its suckers has been reported numerous times. The tree is diseased and needs removal, stump and suckers grinding and replacement with a new tree., 26th February
item.description:
On grass verge immediately between numbers 30 and 32 Ashlands Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Ashlands Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
